definition[0]: if an offer, agreement etc is conditional, it will only be done if something else happens first
example[1]: His agreement to buy our house was conditional on our leaving all the furniture in it.
definition[1]: in grammar, a conditional sentence is one that begins with ‘if’ or ‘unless’ and expresses something that must be true or happen before something else can be true or happen
definition[2]: a sentence or clause that is expressed in a conditional form
definition[3]: if an offer, agreement etc is conditional, it will only be done if something else happens
example[2]: a conditional acceptance of the offer
example[3]: The sale of the company is conditional upon approval by the shareholders.
